jobs.description: About Finch We are on a mission to empower innovators to access the global employment ecosystem and connect the world's employers under a single API. To do this, we're looking for individuals who think about problems holistically and in depth, who are relentlessly curious, self starters, and determined to drive ideas from inception through to completion. Finch is a Series B company backed by a fantastic set of firms, angels, and our developers including General Catalyst, Menlo Ventures, Homebrew, BoxGroup, YCombinator, Charley (1st business hire at Plaid), Sima (ex Head of Biz Dev at Plaid), Henrique + Pedro (co CEOs at Brex), Jeff + Wayne (co CEOs at Digits), Immad (CEO at Mercury), Sam (CEO at Vouch Insurance), Karim (CTO at Ramp), and more. About Our Team We're a team of problem solvers who aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. We value velocity, curiosity, empathy, and diverse perspectives. Everyone on the team is excited about the scope of the problems we address and the potential impact our work can have on the global workforce. We realize that the value we provide comes with great responsibilities, and therefore make security and privacy our highest priorities. We come from a diverse set of backgrounds and each member brings different skills to the group. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and potential will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. About The Role You’ll be the leader for demand generation efforts at Finch, reporting to the VP of Marketing. We’re looking for a hands on, data driven digital and account based marketing (ABM) expert and growth marketer to help us drive and expand awareness and accelerate our pipeline. You will own critical business metrics, laddering directly to new business revenue goals and help us build our tech stack to scale. You will oversee key channels such as paid search & paid social, email marketing, and our new account based marketing (ABM) motion in partnership with the BDR and Sales teams. You will have team/agency support across paid advertising, field marketing, and email. You’ll be joining a small but mighty marketing team of rockstars including Sr PMM and Content leaders to help you operationalize your plans, as well as a standout Revenue Operations leader who will be your partner in tracking and analytics. What You'll Do Own Demand Generation at Finch, including generating inbound and accelerating outbound via paid advertising, marketing automation and nurture, as well as experiments with offline channels. Scale our ABM pilot to be a more effective and targeted engine to connect and convert our ICP in partnership with our sales and revenue operations teams. Drive lead nurture and operational efficiency in our lifecycle/nurture engine. Own and operate our Hubspot instance and leverage Salesforce in partnership with revenue operations. Operationalize and scale our paid growth channels through strategic direction on targeting our ICP, launching new campaigns, and mapping channel activity to lead funnel stage to increase sales cycle efficiency. You’ll work with our paid advertising agency and design contractors to create and execute a systematic testing roadmap to drive results. Analyze and provide insights on multi channel marketing performance including paid channels, SEM, webinars, videos, and email nurture to maximize Finch growth. Extensively use Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Ads, and Google Search Console for conversion rate optimization, SEO & SEM. Develop and manage budgets and forecasts, optimizing initiatives for impact on the bottom line Experiment with non digital channels such as direct mail and gifting (in collaboration with outbound sales) and targeted out of home placements. Support our field marketing program with directed digital outreach and post event one to many nurture. Refine pipeline generation and ROI measurement instrumentation with the revenue ops team. We have some great tools already in place, you’ll get to dream up what’s next! What You'll Bring 5+ years of B2B demand, growth, or marketing operations experience 2+ years of managing a paid program, including working with design & agencies Demonstrated a history of creative problem solving and executing out of the box campaigns Excellent analytics skills ability to assess not just what happens in one channel but how paid, owned and marketing automation channels work together to effectively drive revenue in a sales led growth motion. Insatiable curiosity and passion for data analysis to deliver insights and troubleshooting issues. Ability to make data driven decisions on where to invest next, what hypothesis to test as well as what to scale down and move on. Extensive experience developing and measuring multi channel integrated campaigns that attract, deeply engage and convert prospects into pipeline growth Excellent grasp of marketing automation operation in concert with paid digital and SDR/BDR outreach. (we use Hubspot, but experience with Adobe Marketo, Oracle Eloqua, etc.is helpful) Great collaboration and communication skills. Ability to take the lead on a project and see it through from start to finish while making sure your partners and stakeholders are part of the solution. Ability to spot and operationalize great copy– you won’t always have to do all the writing, but you’ll need to be able to create campaigns for multiple personas and verticals. Skills Growth experience that is multi channel including paid, email and offline channels Experience in analytics, delivering not just channel performance but insights Expert operational proficiency in Hubspot Experience with Salesforce Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Ads, and Google Search Console Analytical expertise extracting not just metrics but channel insights Experience creating a cross channel and cross GTM team testing roadmap Excellent communication, including presentation skills Ability to effectively run cross functional team meetings to align stakeholders across sales, revenue operations and marketing with clear next steps, goals and outcomes Experience working with/managing agencies to supplement capacity $160,000 $180,000 a year Finch’s compensation package includes a competitive base salary benchmarked against real time market data, as well as equity for all full time roles. We want all full time employees to be invested in Finch and to be able to take advantage of that investment, so our equity grants include a 10 year exercise window. We also offer exceptional benefits. Our minimum salary range for this role is: $160,000 $180,000 Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on geography, candidate experience and expertise, and other factors. This is a hybrid role requiring two days per week in office in either our San Francisco or NYC offices. Finch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. show less

jobs.description: Via is using technology to transform transportation around the world. From changing a single person’s daily commute to reducing humanity’s collective environmental footprint — we’ve got huge goals. As our Director of Demand Generation, you’ll lead and coordinate global demand generation efforts for Via’s B2B/B2G partnerships, generating robust and qualified pipelines for our Sales team. In this role, you will collaborate across Via to develop impactful marketing programs that engage our key audiences, generate leads, and create a pipeline that closes. You’ll lead high performing BDR and Campaign teams, focused on digital marketing, scalable programs, and unique integrated campaigns. What You'll Do: Drive global B2B/B2G demand generation strategy and tactics. Take ownership over and be accountable for qualified pipeline to meet revenue targets. Work closely with global Sales leaders to identify priorities audience, region, account, product. Understand target audiences, and drive the creation of new campaigns that are relevant to the right stakeholder at the right time, across all stages of a buyer’s journey. Develop global campaigns with a clear localization strategy, and work with regional teams to enable campaign activation. Build and manage budgets, and collaborate to develop and manage analytics for lead generation, conversion, influence, and revenue growth. Ensure accurate campaign attribution, create new tracking systems as needed, and evaluate campaign effectiveness. Own key digital demand generation channels including SEM, paid social, paid sponsorships, SEO and integrated campaigns. Continue to optimize marketing programs as key contributors to business performance. Develop and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team. Who You Are: A demand generation powerhouse: you bring 7+ years of B2B/B2G marketing experience, and consider yourself a subject matter expert on campaign strategy with proven success in attribution and optimization. Hands on: you can easily navigate your way through demand generation tools, including marketing automation and lead scoring software, ABM and other demand ops tools like Salesforce. A proud data geek: numbers excite you, and you’re comfortable diving head first into complex reports and dashboards. Your analytical expertise allows you to turn data into insights and insights into high performing campaigns. A humble hard worker: no job is too big or too little. An adept manager: you enjoy working with and mentoring others, and lead by doing. You’re good at giving feedback about your team’s work as well as coaching them to present and lead. A nice person: you’re adaptable, good natured, and not easily rattled. You’ve got a solution oriented mindset under pressure. Fierce manager of time: you know the difference between the project that should take a week and the one that should take a day. And you don’t sacrifice quality along the way. Compensation And Benefits Final salary will be determined by the candidate’s experience, knowledge, and skills. Salary reflected does not include equity or variable pay, where applicable. Salary Range: $180,000 $220,000 yearly We are proud to offer a generous and comprehensive benefits package, including free medical plans and 401K matching. Founded in 2012, Via pioneered the TransitTech category by using new technologies to develop public mobility systems — optimizing networks of buses, shuttles, wheelchair accessible vehicles, school buses, autonomous vehicles, and electric vehicles around the globe. Building the world's most efficient, equitable, and sustainable transportation network for all passengers — including those with limited mobility, those without smartphones, and unbanked populations — Via works with its partners to lower the costs of public transit while providing transportation options that rival the convenience of a personal car while reducing environmental impact. At the intersection of transportation and technology, Via is a visionary market leader that combines software innovation with sophisticated service design and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves, providing technology in 650 communities and more than 35 countries and counting. Ready to join the ride? Via is an equal opportunity employer. show less

jobs.description: Position Overview: We are seeking a strategic and results driven Demand Generation leader to scale our inbound marketing efforts. This role will be responsible for creating, executing, and optimizing inbound strategies to attract, engage, and convert high quality prospects into qualified pipeline. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of inbound marketing tactics, content marketing, SEO, paid media, and marketing automation. Key Responsibilities: Strategy Development: Own the end to end inbound demand generation strategy, ensuring alignment with company growth objectives and marketing goals. Lead Generation: Drive the creation of scalable campaigns to generate high quality inbound leads through content marketing, SEO, paid acquisition, email marketing, and other inbound tactics. Content Strategy & SEO: Collaborate with the content team to develop SEO driven content that attracts and converts prospects at different stages of the buyer's journey. Campaign Management: Develop and manage multi channel inbound campaigns that nurture leads and accelerate pipeline growth. Data Driven Optimization: Leverage analytics and reporting tools to measure the effectiveness of campaigns, optimize conversion rates, and provide insights for continuous improvement. Marketing Automation: Optimize the use of marketing automation tools (Marketo.) to segment audiences, personalize communications, and nurture prospects into marketing qualified leads (MQLs). Collaboration with BDR/SDR Team: Partner closely with the BDR/SDR team to ensure seamless handoff of leads and alignment on lead qualification criteria. Budget Management: Oversee the demand generation budget, ensuring effective allocation of resources across channels to maximize ROI. Team Leadership: Build, mentor, and manage a high performing inbound demand generation team, including specialists in paid media, SEO, content, and email marketing. Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in demand generation, with a proven track record of driving inbound growth and pipeline acceleration. Strong expertise in SEO, SEM, content marketing, and marketing automation tools. Experience managing a demand generation team and working cross functionally with sales, product marketing, and field marketing teams. Ability to develop and execute data driven strategies that result in measurable pipeline and revenue growth. Excellent analytical, communication, and project management skills. SaaS and enterprise experience required, financial services is a plus. What we offer: Business casual atmosphere Team focused culture that promotes innovation and ownership Access cutting edge investment reporting technology and expertise RSUs as well as employee stock purchase plan and 401k with match PTO and volunteer time off to give back to the community Defined and undefined career pathways allowing you to grow your own way Work from anywhere 3 weeks out of the year Work from home Fridays Maternity and paternity leave Compensation Range: $150,000 $190,000/YR + Bonus + RSUs (flexible w/range depending on experience) and bonus. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), PTO, parental leave, and medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits. Clearwater Analytics is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. show less

jobs.description: This is Adyen Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition. For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster. Senior Demand Generation Manager At Adyen, we are at the forefront of financial technology, driving innovation in payment solutions for enterprise businesses globally. We are seeking an experienced, data driven and self motivated Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager to drive impactful acquisition strategies for our Unified Commerce business within the North America market. This hybrid role will work from our San Francisco or New York office and report directly to our Unified Commerce Marketing Team Lead. As a Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager at Adyen, you are pipeline driven, highly collaborative, and always learning. You will own the strategic vision for demand generation, including planning, building and optimizing targeted marketing campaigns across owned and paid channels. You’ll work closely with our Sales, SDR and Marketing teams to develop and implement strategies that generate results through the funnel from leads to opportunities. This is a highly matrixed role which will drive results hand in hand with the US, Canada, and Global Marketing teams. The ideal candidate is also highly experienced at stakeholder management and collaborating across Sales, SDRs, Partnerships, and Account Management to meet revenue based goals through integrated marketing tactics. What You’ll Do Strategic Development Propose and implement strategies that drive sales accepted opportunities in collaboration with local and global acquisition marketing teams. Campaign Management Plan, set up, and optimize demand generation programs for North America utilizing tactics such as 1 many, 1 few, and 1 1 account based marketing, as well as paid social, trade publications, display advertising, content syndication, and email marketing. Annual Planning Contribute to the North America annual marketing plan in collaboration with event marketing, product marketing, PR, customer marketing, Canada marketing, and our leadership teams. Market Insights Maintain a pulse on latest marketing trends and the actions of our competitors to continuously optimize strategies Target Account Lists Collaborate with Sales and SDRs to identify and segment target account lists by priority verticals. Content Creation Create compelling content for digital campaigns, web and landing pages, and other marketing materials tailored to prioritized accounts and verticals. Commercial Alignment Work closely with the commercial engine to align efforts, leverage insights, and ensure cohesive execution across all marketing touchpoints. Partner Ecosystem Incorporate key technology partners, payment partners, & alliance partners into the overall marketing strategy. Webinars & Content Manage end to end creation and execution of acquisition focused webinars and content, including goal definition, material crafting, vendor selection, promotion, execution, follow up, and analysis. Analytics & Optimization Utilize analytics tools to assess campaign effectiveness and propose optimizations based on data such as Looker, Marketo reporting, and Salesforce Dashboards. Who You Are Experience Minimum 8 years in a demand generation role with a focus on acquiring new customers. B2B marketing experience and comfort with complex buying committees required. Industry Knowledge Strong understanding of marketing to retail industries. Proven ability to create targeted campaigns that generate high quality leads. Technical Skills Expertise in email marketing, ABM tools, Salesforce, and Marketo. Experience with data driven optimizations and analytics tools is a plus. Analytical Mindset Data driven with strong analytical skills. Capable of optimizing campaigns based on performance metrics. Strategic & Hands On Ability to balance strategic planning with hands on execution and optimization. Self Motivated A proactive, self starter who excels at multitasking, prioritizing, and managing diverse stakeholder needs. Fluent spoken and written English is a requirement Ability to travel domestically and internationally 15%+ The annual base salary range for this role is $135,000 $185,000; to learn more about our compensation philosophy, please click here. This role is based out of our San Francisco or New York office. We are an office first company and value in person collaboration; we do not offer remote only roles. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen. Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application! What’s next? Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility. Adyen is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. San Francisco Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. show less

jobs.description: Why Ivo? Contract negotiation is the most time consuming, costly, and difficult component of the contract lifecycle—and it hasn’t gotten much easier since the days of fax machines. Large language models have unlocked the ability to solve many contract negotiation problems at scale. Our product is best in market (we had a 85% trial win rate in Q3) and rapidly embedding itself into the lives of its users. Position Overview: We are looking for a dynamic, seasoned Marketing Operations pro to own our demand generation efforts and scale our entire funnel lifecycle. You will work directly with the Head of Marketing and play a critical role in shaping and driving our growth strategy. You’ll be responsible for building data driven demand generation campaigns to engage enterprise clients and support our sales team’s efforts to grow our customer base. From top of funnel awareness to conversion, you’ll develop and optimize campaigns that clearly communicate the value of our technology to key decision makers. You’ll lead a mix of inbound and outbound strategies, working closely with sales, product, and customer success to fuel growth and as we establish ourselves as the leader in the AI Contract Review space. Key Responsibilities: Own and execute scaled enterprise demand generation and customer marketing campaigns/initiatives to drive meaningful pipeline growth and expansion opportunities. Own and optimize overall Marketing spend allocation and ROI. Develop and optimize overall lead flow (MQL/SQL) tracking and reporting. Own and accountable for growth forecasting and overall pipeline metrics. Own, optimize, and maintain Marketing tech stack and performance. Qualifications: 5 7 years of experience in B2B (preferably enterprise) Marketing Operations, Growth Marketing, and/or Demand Generation. 5 7 years of experience with Marketing Automation, CRMs, and tracking tools (CAC, CPC/CPM, MAU etc. ). 2 4 years of experience in Marketing team building and/or management. Previously/currently own multi million dollar marketing spend budgets. Strong analytical skills and experience with data driven decision making. Proven track record of managing campaigns that drive pipeline and revenue growth. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Ivo might be a good fit for you if you: Would describe yourself as being relentlessly resourceful. You have a strong internal sense of urgency. You have a bias towards doing things *today*, rather than tomorrow. Experience working in a startup environment is preferred but not required. Are excited about the adventure of building a company! FAQ How far along are we? We launched in early access in April 2023. Since then, we’ve had an incredible response from the market and are growing rapidly. Our clients include companies like Canva, Quora, Zapier, Eventbrite, WordPress and more. We’re happy to share more details with candidates who go through our interview process. Can I work remotely? We require candidates to work with us in person 5 days a week in our San Francisco office. show less

jobs.description: Gong transforms revenue organizations by harnessing customer interactions to increase business efficiency, improve decision making and accelerate revenue growth. The Revenue Intelligence Platform uses proprietary artificial intelligence technology to enable teams to capture, understand and act on all customer interactions in a single, integrated platform. More than 4,000 companies around the world rely on Gong to support their go to market strategies and grow revenue efficiently. For more information, visit www.gong.io. As our Vice President, Growth & Demand Generation, you will lead a talented growing function. You will be responsible for setting the growth strategy and overseeing the execution of demand generation and customer campaigns and tactics to continue on our growth trajectory. Responsibilities Lead a team of growth and campaign marketers focusing on segment and industry growth strategy & tactics. Demand gen, performance marketing, ABM, and customer campaigns are just some of the functions you will be responsible for. Own the pipeline number, working with the extended marketing team to define the growth plan, channel mix, data & analytics for Gong’s growth function to drive net new and expansion pipeline across all segments, across the entire customer lifecycle, and across industries. Scale and optimize n high quality digital channels and multi channel campaign execution including paid search, paid social, email marketing, and webinar programs. Build out a demand center of excellence to enable Gong’s business to scale to drive pipeline growth and support customer retention and expansion. Partner with the GTM Ops and Finance on the strategy needed for the business to hit its ambitious growth targets. Define and own KPIs for targets and tracking performance metrics on a daily or weekly basis and iterate quickly to optimize, proactively detect, and course correct immediately. Partner across functions within marketing to improve our marketing reach, efficiency, and drive outstanding customer experiences. Lead the strategy for executing data driven integrated campaigns in partnership with other marketing teams to reach target audiences and in alignment with strategic market moments to extend reach. Identify and solve business problems with an inquisitive mindset, looking to question assumptions, and bringing creativity to drive business value. Have a strong goal and outcome orientation to marketing efforts. Have the communication skills to convey complex ideas with clarity, confidence, and authority. Hire, develop, and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team. Qualifications 10 15+ years of marketing experience in B2B enterprise software (SaaS experience preferred) with a strong, demonstrable focus on pipeline growth and high quality execution. Proven success in building, developing, and leading demand generation and growth teams. Experience at a company scaling to >$500M and ideally >1B in ARR. World class business acumen with a bias for data driven decision making and velocity of execution. A strong team player but still a self starter who thrives in a fast paced, high growth start up environment. Someone who flourishes when given responsibility and a sense of ownership. Perks & Benefits We offer Gongsters a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs. Wellbeing Fund flexible wellness stipend to support a healthy lifestyle. Mental Health benefits with covered therapy and coaching. 401(k) program to help you invest in your future. Education & learning stipend for personal growth and development. Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work life blend. Paid parental leave to support you and your family. Company wide recharge days each quarter. Work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment. The annual salary hiring range for this position is $270,000 $300,000 USD. Compensation is based on factors unique to each candidate, including, but not limited to, job related skills, qualification, education, experience, and location. At Gong, we have a location based compensation structure, which means there may be a different range for candidates in other locations. The total compensation package for this position, in addition to base compensation, may include incentive compensation, bonus, equity, and benefits. Some of our sales compensation programs also offer the potential to achieve above targeted earnings for those who exceed their sales targets. We are always looking for outstanding Gongsters! So if this sounds like something that interests you regardless of compensation, please reach out. We may have more roles for you to consider and would love to connect. We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry, where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial information through fake interviews and offers. All Gong recruiting email communications will always come from the @gong.io domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Gong via other sources should be ignored. Gong is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. To review Gong's privacy policy, visit https://www.gong.io/gong io job candidates privacy notice/ for more details. show less

jobs.description: Netradyne harnesses the power of Computer Vision and Edge Computing to revolutionize the modern day transportation ecosystem. We are a leader in fleet safety solutions. With growth exceeding 4x year over year, our solution is quickly being recognized as a significant disruptive technology. Our team is growing, and we need forward thinking, uncompromising, competitive team members to continue to facilitate our growth. Position Overview: As the Demand Generation Lead, you will own the strategy, execution, and optimization of end to end growth campaigns across multiple channels. This role requires an individual who is data driven, results oriented, and experienced in crafting multi channel marketing programs that fuel pipeline growth, working closely with sales, SDRs, product marketing, and other Go to Market (GTM) teams. You will be responsible for implementing demand generation and growth strategies that include email marketing, paid media, ABM, webinars, and more to drive high quality leads through the funnel. This position requires someone with a proven track record in B2B marketing, especially in SaaS or high tech sectors. Key Responsibilities: Campaign Strategy & Execution: Lead the development and execution of multi channel growth marketing campaigns, including email, nurture, paid media, organic content, community engagement, and in person events. Program Building: Develop scalable marketing programs such as email nurtures, webinars, digital advertising, and ABM strategies targeting high value accounts. Full Funnel Optimization: Own full funnel metrics, including reach, engagement, MQLs, MQAs, SALs, and pipeline impact, ensuring all campaigns are optimized for success. Cross Functional Collaboration: Partner with sales, SDRs, product marketing, and other GTM teams to ensure marketing efforts are aligned with sales goals and product initiatives. Data Driven Insights: Use data to inform decisions, continuously optimizing campaigns through A/B testing and performance tracking. Deep understanding of marketing analytics, dashboards, and intent data platforms (e.g., Demandbase). Segmentation & Personalization: Develop sophisticated segmentation and targeting strategies to drive personalized experiences across all touchpoints, improving engagement and conversion rates. ABM & Demand Generation: Implement ABM strategies, including "one to few" campaigns, designed to reach key accounts, and use demand capture tactics to convert them through the sales funnel. Website Optimization: Improve the web experience through strategies like reducing form friction, personalization for known visitors, and optimizing conversion paths. Stakeholder Management & Leadership: Influence and communicate with key stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, timely delivery, and execution of projects. Orchestration of GTM Strategy: Serve as a central hub for marketing efforts, ensuring seamless execution across all GTM functions, from demand generation to content strategy. Quality Assurance: Ensure all deliverables meet a high standard of quality and are executed on time. Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in growth marketing, demand generation, or related fields within a high growth B2B SaaS or technology company. Proven ability to lead end to end marketing campaigns with a focus on pipeline generation. Deep understanding of marketing funnels, ABM strategies, and metrics driven campaign optimization. Hands on experience with marketing automation platforms (e.g., Pardot, Marketo) and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce). Experience with demand capture and intent platforms (e.g., Demandbase) and web optimization techniques. Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Proven success in cross functional collaboration, particularly with sales, SDRs, and product marketing teams. Strong project management skills with a track record of delivering on time and within scope. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. jobs.description: Intelligent. Dynamic. Resilient. Everfox, formerly Forcepoint Federal, has been defending the world’s most critical data and networks against the most complex cyber threats imaginable for more than 25 years. As trailblazers in defense grade, high assurance cyber security, we have been leading the way in developing and delivering innovative cyber security technology. We protect data wherever it resides. Our unwavering dedication and commitment to our customers and the critical missions they serve are what set us apart. We are dynamic, vigilant, and proactive in everything we do. Our suite of cross domain, threat protection and insider risk solutions empower governments and enterprise organizations to use data safely where and however their people need it. At Everfox, we innovate, we invest, we achieve. We protect what matters most to our customers. And we offer protection like no other. We do all of this so our customers can focus on what matters most… their mission. Job Title: Manager, Demand Generation Department: Marketing Location: Remote Reports To: Chief Marketing Officer Position Overview We are seeking a strategic and results driven Manager, Demand Generation to join our marketing team. This role is pivotal in driving awareness and interest in our cybersecurity products through a blend of digital marketing and in person events. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in demand generation, with a proven track record of creating and executing successful multi channel campaigns that generate new top of funnel pipeline and expand on existing opportunities within target accounts. Key Responsibilities Develop and Execute Campaigns: Plan and implement multi channel marketing campaigns that drive demand and lead generation, utilizing digital platforms and in person events. So far, our customers, users, and ourselves have built over 10,000 connectors and have had 200,000+ companies install Airbyte. We've raised $181M from the world's top investors (Benchmark, Accel, Altimeter, Coatue, Y Combinator, etc.) and we believe in product led growth, where we build something awesome that all our users love. We’re committed to providing as much context to our current employees and candidates. The Airbyte company handbook, core values, methodology, strategy, and roadmap are open to all. Airbyte is in person in our Embarcadero office weekly. If you find this role exciting, we encourage you to apply even if you think you don’t meet all requirements Opportunity We are looking for a passionate and visionary Growth Lead to drive and optimize Airbyte’s customer acquisition and engagement strategy, across and beyond the 7,000 daily active companies already using our technology. This role will lead initiatives across the entire customer journey, with a strong emphasis on “GTM engineering”, including ABM, warm outbound and next gen nurturing programs. You will play a key role in shaping our demand generation strategy aimed at generating an enterprise pipeline for our sales team and aligning closely with GTM, product, and sales teams to drive revenue growth. Performance Analysis & Optimization: define, track, and report on key performance metrics, making data driven adjustments to enhance ROI, engagement, and conversion rates across the lifecycle .Leverage Technical Expertise and build the GTM Stack: build and optimize data driven marketing workflows using new emerging tools, including lead enrichment, automated outreach, personalization, and ABM to amplify campaign effectiveness. Cross Functional Collaboration: partner with Product, Sales, and GTM leaders to ensure alignment on goals, share insights, and drive cohesive strategies that support business objectives. jobs.description: About Checkr Checkr builds people infrastructure for the future of work. We've designed a faster—and fairer—way to screen job seekers. Established in 2014, Checkr puts modern technology powered by machine learning in the hands of hiring teams, helping to hire great new people with an experience that’s fast, smooth, and safe. Checkr has over 100,000 customers including DoorDash, Coinbase, Lyft, Instacart, and Airtable. A career at Checkr means collaborating with brilliant minds, disrupting an industry, and opening channels of employment to often overlooked candidates. Checkr is recognized on Forbes Cloud 100 2024 List and is a Y Combinator 2024 Breakthrough Company. About The Team/role Checkr Trust is building safer communities by providing our customers with risk signals about its users. Every year, our team provides insights on tens of millions of users across multiple verticals: online dating, caregiving, car rental, short term rentals, and many more. We are part of Horizon 3Y, the Checkr start up lab: we operate with the speed of a small startup while enjoying the leverage and resources of a well known technology brand. We are looking for a Senior Demand Generation Manager to play a pivotal role in the continued growth of our startup. In this role, you will report directly to the Vice President and GM of Checkr Trust. What You’ll Do Strategy: Develop integrated campaign and target account strategies across growth channels in collaboration with sales team Execution: Own the execution and optimization of ICP campaigns across web, email, advertising, webinars, direct mail, outbound, and direct mail channels in partnership with Product Marketing Website: Drive optimization via experimentation on landing pages in close collaboration with design and product marketing Creative: Partner with design and product marketing to test and optimize creative concepts for promotion across campaign channels Manage: Own the paid media budget, determining optimal spend allocations across channels based on goals Analytics: Measure and analyze datasets to understand paid marketing funnel, campaign effectiveness, and ROI, and identify opportunities for improvement, and Stakeholders: Collaborate and partner with Sales to own and optimize lead hand off process, Product Marketing to plan and execute campaigns, What You Bring Deep expertise in digital / performance marketing across search, social, affiliate, and display channels (6+ years preferred). Hands on experience managing paid search campaigns at scale is a must have. Experience managing agencies is a plus. Strong analytical mindset. Experience analyzing campaign datasets, website metrics, and internal conversion data with a proven ability to translate data insights into action Proficient with basic analytical tools (Google Sheets/Excel, Looker, Google Analytics) Ability to drive projects forward across multiple teams and manage multiple campaigns at once in a fast paced environment Experience with Hubspot or other CRM tools, Salesforce, and creative tools like Canva or Figma are a plus Have founded or held early roles at fast paced startups is a plus What You’ll Get A fast paced and collaborative environment Learning and development allowance Competitive cash and equity compensation and opportunity for advancement 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services Flexible PTO policy Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend At Checkr, we believe a hybrid work environment strengthens collaboration, drives innovation, and encourages connection. Our hub locations are Denver, CO, San Francisco, CA, and Santiago, Chile. Individuals are expected to work from the office 2 to 3 days a week. In office perks are provided, such as lunch four times a week, a commuter stipend, and an abundance of snacks and beverages. One of Checkr’s core values is Transparency. To live by that value, we’ve made the decision to disclose salary ranges in all of our job postings. We use geographic cost of labor as an input to develop ranges for our roles and as such, each location where we hire may have a different range. If this role is remote, we have listed the top to the bottom of the possible range, but we will specify the target range for an exact location when you are selected for a recruiting discussion. For more information on our compensation philosophy, see our website. The base salary range for this role is $147,451 to $173,472 in San Francisco, CA. Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace. Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance. show less

jobs.description: The Director of Demand Generation will be a key player in driving our growth strategy by developing and executing scalable programs that generate high quality leads, nurture prospects, and increase pipeline velocity. This role requires a data driven, creative, and collaborative leader with deep expertise in B2B marketing and SaaS. Responsibilities The primary responsibilities of this role include: Strategy Development: Own the demand generation strategy to achieve pipeline and revenue goals aligned with company objectives. Campaign Leadership: Plan, execute, and optimize multi channel campaigns across digital, email, events, ABM, and paid media to generate leads and accelerate pipeline growth. Cross Functional Leadership: Ensure alignment with sales and product teams for consistent messaging and effective execution. ABM Expertise: Develop account based marketing (ABM) strategies for high value accounts, ensuring personalized and impactful outreach. Pipeline Optimization: Partner with Revenue Operations to define, track, and analyze KPIs, continuously optimizing campaigns for ROI. Marketing Technology: Leverage tools such as Salesforce and other Martech solutions to drive automation, segmentation, and personalization at scale. Content Collaboration: Work closely with product marketing to align messaging with audience needs and lifecycle stages. Budget Management: Own and manage the demand generation budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources for maximum impact. Flexible work style comfortable in a fast moving, highly energy and evolving environment Excellent project management, planning and organizational skills Ability to multi task and meet deadlines while paying attention to details Experience in a rapid growth, fast paced environment with a demonstrated history of goal setting and achievement. A blend of analytical and creative skills with a strong affinity for getting things done. A strong analytical mind that measures success via metrics and measurable goals. Requirements: To be successful in this role the incumbent will demonstrate the following: 8+ years of experience in demand generation or growth marketing, with at least 3 years in a leadership role. Proven track record in driving pipeline and revenue growth in a SaaS B2B environment. Expertise in ABM strategies, paid media, email marketing, and marketing automation. Strong analytical skills with experience in attribution models, A/B testing, and campaign performance analysis. Exceptional leadership, communication, and collaboration skills. Proficiency in CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation platforms, and data analytics tools. Experience managing and building reports in Salesforce. Criteria drives talent success for over 4,500 organizations around the world. Through innovative assessments, video interviewing, and talent management tools, we help companies build more engaged workforces, improve retention, generate more revenue, and increase productivity. jobs.description: Who We Are Verkada is a leader in cloud based B2B physical security. Verkada offers six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace and intercoms — integrated with a single cloud based software platform. Designed with simplicity and scalability in mind, Verkada gives organizations the real time insight to know what could impact the safety and comfort of people throughout their physical environment, while empowering them to take immediate action to minimize security risks, workplace frustrations and costly inefficiencies. Founded in 2016 with more than $460M in funding raised to date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 15 offices across three continents, 2,100+ full time employees and 28,000+ customers across 70+ countries. Overview At Verkada, we're known to push traditional boundaries, and our B2B marketing efforts are no exception. We're reinventing growth here. As the Director of Enterprise Demand Generation, you'll be in charge of building and managing a team of entrepreneurial marketers with a wide variety of career experience across science/engineering, investment banking, corporate strategy, growth marketing and B2B marketing. As we challenge traditional B2B marketing ideology and build a uniquely scalable lead generation machine, we hope to hire a hands on builder with strong ability to build and manage a team, high brainpower and EQ that is passionate to make an immediate impact. This is the perfect opportunity to have full ownership of the top strategic enterprise accounts we wish to penetrate into. As we challenge traditional B2B marketing ideology and build a uniquely scalable lead generation machine, we hope to hire someone with the wit, panache, and confidence to quickly contribute high level strategies and make an immediate impact. A stint on this team will open doors, propel your career, and provide you with highly sought after skills for any role, at Verkada or elsewhere. We are committed to a thriving in office culture. This role requires that you be on site at our HQ in San Mateo, CA 5 days a week. Responsibilities Work alongside Verkada’s CMO and the Growth team to brainstorm and execute on new out of the box experiments to deliver, target, and run marketing campaigns that drive direct revenue impact Strategize and execute on ABM or volume based campaigns that quantitatively prove impact to the bottom line of our top strategic accounts. Engage with a fast growing Enterprise Sales teams to support partner marketing efforts and team goals Partner with the content, solutions and creative marketing teams to best position our products across multiple industries. Work closely with the marketing operations team to automate and scale campaigns that are widely ROI positive. Build a team of highly motivated individuals with high IQ/EQ who can operate together to hit pipeline and revenue targets. Qualifications 4 year undergraduate bachelor's degree (top 20 school highly preferred) 7 12 years of work experience including at least 2 years in marketing At least 2 years of management experience of full time employees Business level english fluency in verbal and written communication Impeccable quantitative ability to analyze data A hacker’s type mentality full of curiosity and creativity Relentless puzzle solving obsession Inbox 0 type personality SQL, Python (or equivalent), and Javascript strongly preferred Pay Disclosure At Verkada, we want to attract and retain the best employees, and compensate them in a way that appropriately and fairly values their individual contribution to the company. With that in mind, we carefully consider a number of factors to determine the appropriate starting pay for an employee, including their primary work location and an assessment of a candidate’s skills and experience, as well as market demands and internal parity. This estimate can vary based on the factors described above, so the actual starting annual base salary may be above or below this range. This estimate is also just one component of Verkada’s total rewards package. A Verkada employee may be eligible for additional forms of compensation, depending on their role, including sales incentives, discretionary bonuses, and/or equity in the company in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). Estimated Annual Pay Range $230,000—$280,000 USD Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. All applicants for positions at Verkada will be treated without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Your application will be handled in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Policy. show less

jobs.description: Samba TV tracks streaming and broadcast video across the world with our proprietary data and technology. We are on a mission to fundamentally transform the viewing experience for everyone. Our data enables media companies to connect with audiences for new shows and movies, and enables advertisers to engage viewers and measure reach across all their devices. We have an amazing story with a unique perspective on culture formed by a global footprint of data and AI driven insights We are seeking a dynamic B2B Head of Growth Marketing to join our team and help drive sales revenue. The ideal candidate is an ABM savvy performance marketing expert who has a proven record of helping sales teams exceed quotas by developing innovative strategies and leveraging cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for a self starter to collaborate with a strong cross functional marketing team and build a demand generation program for a growing company. Responsibilities Develop and execute a comprehensive Demand Gen framework that drives consideration and preference for Samba products, generates high quality leads for sales, and ultimately contributes to revenue growth. Create and implement innovative, multi channel campaigns across SEO, SEM, retargeting, display ads, email, ABM, and events to drive awareness, consideration, and purchase intent. Own ABM strategy and execution, leveraging the 6Sense platform and other tools to orchestrate relevant, trusted marketing and sales actions throughout the B2B customer journey. Collaborate with Sales and other teams to define ideal customer profiles, buyer personas, and targeted segments, ensuring leads are effectively addressed and nurtured. Lead the development of a content plan that maps the right content to each stage of the customer journey for each buyer persona, including the creation of compelling ad copy and landing pages. Establish Key Performance Indicators and create insightful Performance Measurement Dashboards that assess the impact of various marketing activities on revenue generation. Define and continuously refine the conversion stages within the sales funnel, ensuring proper tracking and analysis of lead progression. Identify bottlenecks and optimization opportunities to improve conversion rates at each stage. Regularly communicate performance results and insights to marketing, executive staff, and sales management. Work closely with the Business Operations team to optimize processes for lead flow to the Sales organization, including the integration and enhancement of marketing automation tools such as 6Sense, Salesforce, and Hubspot. Explore and implement AI assisted technologies, improve efficiency, and drive better results while ensuring a smooth transition and alignment with team goals. Requirements Bachelor's Degree or higher Currently requiring 3 days a week on site in office, with a possibility of moving to 5 days in the future Strong proficiency in 6Sense, Salesforce, Hubspot, Google Analytics, Meta for Business, and LinkedIn Ads Proven ability to ideate and execute creative new user acquisition initiatives and adapt to various roles as needed Extensive experience running successful demand/lead gen campaigns and operations, utilizing a wide range of digital marketing tactics such as display, social ads, SEM, SEO, email blasts, and ABM Exceptional project management skills and a strong problem solving mindset Skilled in creating insightful measurement reports and dashboards that demonstrate the impact of marketing efforts on revenue Familiarity with Webflow is a plus Passion for staying up to date with the latest marketing technologies and trends, including AI assisted tools, and applying them to drive growth Samba TV is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact. Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU , Samba Inc. is the data controller. Samba TV expects to offer a base salary between $170,000 $180,000 USD per year for roles to be performed in New York or California; actual base salary offered will depend on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. Base salary is just one component of Samba TV’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include an annual bonus opportunity, short term incentives, and long term incentives. In addition, Samba provides health insurance, wellness offerings, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO), and other employee benefits. show less

jobs.description: About Us Wrapbook is a smart, intuitive platform that makes production payroll and accounting easier, faster, and more secure. We provide a unified payroll platform that seamlessly connects your entire team—production, accounting, cast, and crew—all in one place. Wrapbook empowers production teams to manage projects, pay cast and crew, track expenses, and generate data driven insights, while enabling workers to manage timecards, track pay, and onboard to new projects from any device. Wrapbook brings clarity and dependability to production payroll, while increasing the productivity of your whole team. Trusted by companies of all sizes, Wrapbook powers payroll for some of the industry’s top production companies, including SMUGGLER, Tuff, and GhostRobot. Our growing team of 250+ people across the USA and Canada, including entertainment and technology experts from SAG AFTRA, DGA, IATSE, Teamsters, Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook, and more. Wrapbook is backed by top tier investors, including Jeffrey Katzenberg’s WndrCo, Andreessen Horowitz, and A* Capital. We have raised $130M and are in a strong financial position. The Opportunity We're seeking an experienced Director of Demand Generation to join our Marketing team. You'll report directly to the head of Marketing and play a crucial role in driving our growth strategy. Your primary responsibility will be to generate high quality B2B pipeline and hit ambitious revenue targets through innovative ABM strategies. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully scaling demand generation functions in mid to late stage tech startups with complex buying motions, to large MM and Enterprise accounts. You should be adept at targeting multiple defined personas within buying units and have experience in both vertical specific and individual account targeting. Your expertise should include implementing surround sound approaches that yield measurable results and strong LTV to CAC ratios. At Wrapbook, we believe in data driven decision making and continuous optimization. In this role, you'll be expected to: Develop and execute comprehensive, engaging demand generation strategies that align with our business goals and target audience Lead and mentor a small but mighty team of DG specialists Collaborate closely with sales, product marketing, and other cross functional teams to ensure alignment and maximize results Implement and optimize ABM campaigns targeting key accounts and industries Analyze campaign performance and iterate to maximize pipe creation and movement Manage and optimize demand generation budget to ensure maximum ROI To excel in this role, you'll need to have a deep understanding of B2B marketing best practices, stay current with emerging trends and technologies, and be able to adapt quickly in a fast paced environment. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels will be crucial to our success. What You'll Do Develop and execute comprehensive demand generation strategies aligned with our business goals and target audience Lead and mentor a high performing team across multiple channels Implement and optimize ABM campaigns targeting key accounts and industries Collaborate closely with sales, product marketing, and other cross functional teams to ensure alignment and maximize results Analyze campaign performance, market trends, and competitor activities to inform strategy and tactics Manage and optimize demand generation budget to ensure maximum ROI and strong LTV to CAC ratios What You’ll Have 7+ years of strong DG / Growth experience, at least some of which in a demanding high growth startup, which you enjoyed and excelled at. 3+ years of people management experience small teams ok Past experience scaling demand generation efforts for enterprise level accounts A passion for driving measurable results and hitting ambitious KPIs while marketing an exciting disruptor for a vertical industry. Strong desire to own the pipe number to back into revenue goals at a high growth startup. Great presentation and dashboard skills to be able to show your measurable results clearly on a regular basis be able to tell the bigger picture story along with the numbers. Tech stack: Salesforce; Marketo or other email automation; 6sense, Demandbase or other buyer intent platform Why Join Us At Wrapbook, creativity meets technology — and not just in the product. jobs.description: About Vercel: Vercel’s Frontend Cloud provides the developer experience and infrastructure to build, scale, and secure a faster, more personalized web. Customers like Under Armour, eBay, The Washington Post, Johnson & Johnson, and Zapier use Vercel to build dynamic user experiences on the web. At Vercel, our mission is to enable the world to ship the best products and that goes hand in hand with creating an environment where you can do the best work of your life. About the Role: Vercel is looking for a Director of Demand Generation to develop the strategy and oversee execution of programs that target prospective & current buyers, create awareness, generate leads, and engage with our sales & customer success organization. Your role is to work strategically to increase conversions and generate net new and expansion pipeline globally by building integrated marketing campaigns, optimizing our declared intent funnel, accelerating our product led Sales motion, and automated outbound plays. We’re looking for a highly strategic, modern Demand Gen leader that has a strong track record of building high performing Demand Generation, Field Marketing and/or Partner Marketing teams at a developer tools company. Hitting aggressive revenue targets in a rapid and high growth startup environment must be your happy place. You can easily pivot between high level strategic thinking and vision setting while also being the executor with an eye on the details and getting your hands into data. What You Will Do: Collaborate with leaders on GTM strategy. Align with Sales and Customer Success Leadership on priorities and develop the strategy, planning and execution of Vercel’s integrated demand generation model, budget and plan to hit quarterly pipeline within our ICP. This includes tight coordination of inbound, product led, and outbound outreach pre and post programs to maximize pipeline creation. Ship quality developer focused integrated campaigns. Work with Product Marketing, Brand Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to strategize and ship integrated campaigns through a results driven approach, both in existing channels and by experimenting with new channels/techniques, that support enterprise pipeline goals. Conversion Rate Optimization. Own objectives across the marketing funnel—Inquiry to SQO to Closed Won—track and optimize performance at each stage in the funnel, and create a predictable demand generation engine. You must be fluent in inbound and product led sales optimization strategies to accelerate pipeline generation efforts. Build end to end funnel programs that convert. Push our communications to the next level using data driven decision making and creativity. You'll identify the most effective channel, marketing message, value proposition, materials, and call to action for specific personas and target segments. Partner with Analytics & MOPs to build for scale. Partner with Analytics & RevOps teams on developing and tracking key metrics including marketing performance measurement, budgeting, strategic planning, process definition, and marketing systems/data. Own the demand funnel analysis. You will live and breathe our enterprise demand funnel—diagnosing pipeline generation issues and proactively solving them. You will also be the face of marketing enterprise pipeline reporting to the GTM—requiring you to define KPIS and implement measurement, analysis, benchmarking and reporting methods to gauge success. Alignment with Sales Ensure highly productive relationship with Sales, forging exemplary communication and aligning on campaign and target account strategy—we are the same team. About You: Deep understanding of the developer ecosystem and the frontend development landscape. Passion for open source (bonus if Next.js) and a deep understanding of the Vercel platform and its value proposition. 8+ years of experience in B2B SaaS marketing, with a proven track record of success in leading and scaling high performing teams. Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams. jobs.description: The Head of Demand Generation will be instrumental in driving growth and brand awareness for DataSnipper’s suite of products by leading high impact demand generation initiatives. Responsible for strategic campaign planning and execution, budget management, and performance tracking, you will leverage your industry knowledge to expand demand in new and existing segments across all relevant channels. Supported by a cutting edge marketing tech stack, you will also play a crucial role in optimizing and advancing our tech capabilities. Responsibilities Demand Generation Strategy: Develop and execute a robust demand generation program designed to drive high quality leads, prioritizing quality over volume where it counts. A core element of this strategy will focus on raising awareness for DataSnipper’s brand in New Industries that will spark our future growth. Cross Functional Collaboration: Partner with cross functional teams to craft compelling campaigns that educate prospects on their challenges and enhances DataSnipper's authority as a solution leader in the industry. Team Leadership and Development: Opportunity to build and lead a high performing team responsible for the end to end demand generation function in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Campaign Planning: Execute innovative and effective lead generation campaigns through digital channels, events, channel partnerships, and thoughtfully crafted email campaigns. jobs.description: About us Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper connected world. Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real and happening daily. About the role Cybersecurity threats have become the fastest growing risk impacting small and midsize businesses, with cybercrime costing businesses $6 trillion+ in 2022 alone. Coalition has pioneered a unique approach to help protect small and midsize businesses from cyber risk by combining technology and insurance to help protect our customers from fast moving digital risks. We’re seeking a Director of Demand Generation to manage a team of high performing marketers across our insurance and cybersecurity business lines. This is a strategic new hire tasked with elevating our campaign strategy, design, planning and execution capabilities across multiple segments and business lines. Ideal candidates will be experienced and eager to flex across proven B2B SaaS growth tactics for our cybersecurity business, as well as novel strategies for engaging our insurance based broker channel. The role will own campaign orchestration, channel performance, reporting and optimization within the demand generation organization. Critical stakeholders include the PMM and content teams, as well as forging strong relationships with our sales organization. Utilizing a mix of owned, earned and paid channels, you will optimize our industry leading position within cyber insurance, while building a nascent but rapidly growing cyber security SaaS business. Success in this role would result in increasing the submission pipeline for Coalition’s insurance products through our broker channel, while driving ARR in our security business. Past experience leveraging channels or intermediaries in the sales process is a plus. Responsibilities Own the campaign planning and execution function to drive coherent and impactful marketing campaigns across audience segments. Build repeatable processes for designing customer journeys, budget, and personnel allocation. Lead, mentor, and manage a team of campaign managers, providing guidance on campaign development, best practices, and performance optimization. Monitor the progress and results of marketing campaigns to ensure they meet objectives and provide reports to executive leadership on campaign performance, ROI, and market impact. Work with data teams to design and build requirements for segmentation and audience targeting Work closely with PMMs and Content teams to ensure the coordinated delivery of all elements related to campaign requirements Collaborate with Sales and other cross functional teams as needed to ensure alignment of marketing strategies with sales objectives and increase utilization of marketing content Allocate and manage marketing budgets, ensuring effective use of resources across various campaigns and projects. Skills and Qualifications 7+ years of experience in a demand generation or growth marketing role. Previous leadership experience managing teams in high performance environments Experience driving vertical marketing or channel based programs via field sales. Insurance and/or fintech and healthtech verticals are a plus but not required. Experience driving multi channel, high performing, integrated campaigns to meet marketing goals and objectives. Proficiency in performance analysis, campaign assessment, and audience segmentation Exceptional communication, problem solving, teamwork, and the ability to handle high levels of ambiguity. High attention to detail, and the ability to lead and manage complex projects effectively Solid understanding of online and offline channels (such as email, social, paid ads, DM etc), attribution, best practices and tracking Skillfully manage senior leadership/exec/C level to communicate on campaigns Ability to set clear goals, identify possible blockers, make the right tradeoffs and mediate between teams to find best possible outcomes for the organization Budget Management: Proficiency in planning and managing campaign budgets to maximize ROI Project Planning: Strong organizational skills to plan and coordinate multiple campaigns simultaneously. Previous experience and understanding of how to leverage automation tools and martech to creatively execute and report on campaign results. Compensation Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The US base salary for this position ranges from $160,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $200,000/year in our highest geographic market. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors, which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process. Coalition, Inc. reserves the right to modify this range as needed. Perks 100% medical, dental and vision coverage Flexible PTO policy Annual home office stipend and WeWork access Mental & physical health wellness programs (One Medical, Headspace, Wellhub, and more)! Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement Why Coalition? We’re a remote first, mission driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk. Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion. jobs.description: The Role: As Pilot's (Sr.) Demand Generation Manager, you will play a pivotal role in accelerating our revenue growth. Your charter will be to lead the creation and implementation of marketing programs and strategies that will grow and accelerate qualified pipeline and closed revenue in the Technology vertical. This position requires a strategic, hands on executor with knowledge of both product led and sales led motions and industry expertise who will sit between sales, product, and marketing. We’re building a best in class demand generation engine that will scale Pilot to $100M ARR and beyond and you will lead the revenue generation efforts in our largest industry vertical. Key Responsibilities: Demand Generation Strategy Development: Develop and execute on a comprehensive demand generation strategy in the Technology Vertical that supports our business and growth goals. Ensure the strategy aligns with company goals, integrating with product priorities, sales initiatives, and marketing objectives. Cross functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales teams to understand their objectives, challenges, and feedback. Align strategies and campaigns with sales goals to support lead and pipeline generation. Facilitate sales and marketing alignment making sure were getting insights, sharing campaign performance, and adjusting tactics with feedback from sales. Work with sales and product teams to develop messaging, positioning, and outreach tactics that engage prospects and accelerate pipeline generation. Campaign Planning and Execution: Plan and implement omni channel campaigns across web, SEO, email, social, content, and events. Forecast, track and report on campaign performance. Run experiments in new channels and test campaign variables that will optimize performance. Content Development to Support Demand Generation: Collaborate with product teams to create compelling content that resonates with the target audience and drives lead generation. Utilize content across channels to engage prospects and nurture leads throughout the sales funnel. Lead Generation and Nurture: Build omni channel lead generation programs. Oversee the lead lifecycle from lead creation through sales handoff, including lead gen, timely sales follow up, defining MQLs, building nurture programs that engage prospects. Create repeatable, scalable, always on nurture programs that drive MQLs, meetings, and pipeline. About You: Have 7+ years of working experience with 5+ years hands on experience in Demand Generation at an high growth, high velocity, B2B sales lead company, with exposure to selling into venture backed startups. Extensive marketing channel expertise spanning paid ads, direct mail, webinars, field events, etc. and how to package these into campaigns to drive leads and sales opportunities. Approach demand gen with an experimental mindset and are comfortable with data analysis to measure program impact. Familiarity with attribution, campaign performance and forecasting. Working knowledge of our MarTech stack SFDC, Marketo, Bizible/Marketo Measure. Proven ability to thrive in a fast paced startup environment, managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously. Expert communicator and collaborator. Experience in working with multiple stakeholders to drive a project or program to success Join us at Pilot and help build a marketing machine that drives sustainable and scalable revenue growth. Your expertise and dedication will be key in shaping our entire GTM function and contributing to Pilot’s overall success. About Pilot Pilot launched in 2017 to bring the back office into the modern era. Pilot provides small businesses with dedicated finance experts which Pilot hires as full time, U.S. based employees who learn the ins and outs of their business. Pilot integrates directly with the billing, banking, expense, and payroll systems customers already use. With a special blend of custom software and expert bookkeepers, Pilot delivers accurate, consistent bookkeeping and financial management and tax services that give entrepreneurs the freedom to focus on their business. Pilot has over 1,000 customers and has raised over $170 million in financing from Sequoia, Index Ventures, Stripe, Bezos Expeditions, and Whale Rock. Our investors also include a long list of world class entrepreneurs, including Patrick and John Collison, Drew Houston, and Diane Greene. Our most recent funding round doubled our valuation to $1.2 billion – Meet Fintech’s Newest Unicorn. Why Pilot? We invest in our employees’ development and happiness because our employees are the keys to our success and ensuring happy customers The opportunity to join a seasoned founding team that has led companies through two prior successful startups and acquisitions (by Oracle and Dropbox) Flexible vacation/time off policy All federal holidays are observed Competitive benefits package including wellness benefits Parental leave for birthing or non birthing parents – 100% pay for 12 weeks 401(k) plan The base pay range target for the role seniority described in this job description is $106k $215k in most remote locations, and between $133k $215k in San Francisco, CA and New York City, NY. Final offer amounts depend on multiple factors such as candidate experience and expertise, geographic location, total compensation, and market data. In addition to cash pay, full time regular positions are eligible for equity, 401(k), health benefits, and other benefits; some of these benefits may be available for part time or temporary positions.
