jobs.description: Who We Are WillowTree, a TELUS Digital Company, partners with the world’s leading brands to help them tackle their thorniest challenges be it launching new digital products, delivering personalized marketing at scale, or harnessing the power of data and AI to transform their business. These mission critical initiatives aren’t solved by a single discipline. Great digital is a team game it requires seamlessly combining strategy, engineering, design, data science, marketing, and more. Other firms have bolted on these capabilities as digital natives, we’ve built them into our teams from Day 1. The result? Top and bottom lines that grow, alongside our client’s capabilities. Check out how we have impacted our clients' digital portfolios over the years. Location Our Demand Generation Manager is an integral part of our team at WillowTree. To help retain our deep culture of collaboration, this role will maintain an in office presence in a hybrid capacity in our Charlottesville (VA) or Boston (MA) offices. The Opportunity As a Demand Generation Manager at WillowTree you will be a strategic thinker and proactive doer who partners strongly with BD, delivery, and demand gen leadership to support the execution of multi channel campaigns, eschewing content from concept to reality, organizing webinars, informing advertising, supporting event marketing, and doing all the things it takes to build and sustain a drumbeat of market noise for a specific product/service over an extended period of time. You will be responsible for the ultimate delivery of campaigns from start to finish by ensuring your efforts help to drive revenue by collecting sales & marketing intelligence that informs BD’s go to market and making sure that the dots between the sales and marketing team remain seamlessly connected. Responsibilities Develop and execute demand generation campaigns to develop and nurture relationships with prospects within our target account lists. Partner with the VP of Demand Generation as a strategic contributor and as key driver of progress by managing stakeholders across the business and projects. Help articulate and evangelize WillowTree’s point of view within service lines, verticals, and the intersection between the two by leading the ideation, development, and syndication of thought leadership content. Help translate key market trends and WillowTree’s brand positioning to inform the creative development of digital advertising campaigns. Develop and activate new Sales & Marketing “plays” that connect the dots between market intelligence derived from marketing campaigns and our Business Development teams. Lead sales enablement initiatives that educate the Business Development team on our latest service offerings by partnering with Delivery leaders to understand what’s new. Act as the voice of the client for the service lines and personas you represent by becoming an expert in their markets, challenges, and opportunities. Closely collaborate with our Business Development VPs to crystallize ideal customer profiles, augment target account lists, and bring market trends to the forefront. Develop repeatable go to market mechanics that scale with the growth of the business. Qualifications Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams. Ability to write clearly and persuasively for both internal and external audiences. Robust analytical and problem solving abilities, coupled with the talent to make data driven recommendations. Working knowledge of our industry and/or knowledge of one or more of WillowTree's core verticals or service lines. Data & AI being a big plus. Intermediate level or higher proficiency in SalesForce, ability to create campaigns, track campaign performance, and run reports to surface insights. Bonus points for candidates with an MBA. Why WillowTree? We offer a place to be yourself. Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That’s why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You’ll work hard here; however, we’ll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well being. We’re committed to creating an environment of inclusion — a place where every Tree can thrive. We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits. WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. What We'll Offer In addition to a great culture and interesting work with opportunities for growth and development, this position is eligible for the following benefits: Healthcare benefits Medical, Vision, Dental (Including an option for 100% coverage of individual employee medical premiums) Life & Disability Insurance 401K matching Flexible paid time off & paid company holidays Parental Leave Employee Share Purchase Plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) And more! Individual compensation is based on various factors unique to each candidate, including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job related reasons determined during the interview process. Role ranges are periodically reviewed and updated based on market changes, internal needs, and industry trends. To drive ongoing pay equity for team members, WillowTree conducts regular compensation audits. USA Pay Range $140,000 — $160,000 USD show less

ABOUT RETOOL Nearly every company in the world runs on custom software: Gartner estimates that up to 50% of all code is written for internal use. This is the operational software for refunding orders, underwriting loans, onboarding employees, analyzing transactions, and providing customer support. But most companies don’t have adequate resources to properly invest in these tools, leading to a lot of old and clunky internal software or, even worse, users still stuck in manual and spreadsheet flows. At Retool, we’re on a mission to bring good software to everyone. We’re building a new type of development platform that combines the benefits of traditional software development with a drag and drop UI editor and AI, making it dramatically faster to build internal tools. We believe that the future of software development lies in abstracting away the tedious and repetitive tasks developers waste time on, while creating reusable components that act as a force multiplier for future developers and projects. The result is not just productivity, but good software by default. And that’s a mission worth striving for. Today, our customers span from small startups building their first operational tools to Fortune 500 companies building mission critical apps for thousands of users across their business. Interested in joining us? Let us know! WHY WE’RE LOOKING FOR YOU As the Head of Demand Gen you will own the pipeline number that drives Retool’s growth. Retool has both a robust PLG as well as Sales led motion and we sell deals from 10k to $1M. We’re looking for a seasoned executive who has seen a variety of marketing models and strategies and can creatively problem solve for what Retool needs in this stage of growth, for our product and market, and not simply “run the playbook” from your last company. We have ambitious plans for the company and the Head of Demand Gen is at the center of making this happen. You will craft the marketing and demand gen strategy in collaboration with other sales and marketing leaders and drive the execution that predictably gets us to our pipeline goals. In doing so, you’ll build close ties with the sales and BDR teams. You’ll work closely with our RevOps and Data teams to ensure marketing has the instrumentation and dashboards we need to be successful. Ultimately we’re looking for a results oriented leader who believes in data driven decisions, is unafraid to drive change where it’s needed, and has the leadership qualities needed to build a high performing team. WHAT YOU'LL DO: Create a comprehensive demand generation plan to achieve our targets Optimize channel strategy for both PLG (organic traffic, paid search, growth) and Sales led channels (Paid Social, Email, Field) Work closely with RevOps and Data teams to ensure we’re measuring every step of the funnel vs. making do with what’s in place today. Guiding the team to be data driven in their strategies and decision making. Creating a culture of actively reporting on successes and misses, learning from those misses and continuously iterating. Grow a nascent outbound program. Bring experience on helping a company that has primary relied on Inbound in the past to build an Outbound motion across not just Demand Gen but working closely with PMM, BDRs and Sales. Has marketed to multiple personas and knows how to create strategies to support multiple personas along long sales cycles. Has experience with ABM strategies to build programs for both high ACV land and expand deals. Has the personality and energy to drive change from the way we did things to the way we need to Will be a strong leader and voice in the marketing org and company as a whole THE SKILLSET YOU'LL BRING: 10+ years of direct experience in Demand Generation & Growth 20+ years of total relevant experience A track record of delivering on pipeline targets in the scale of 25 million+ a quarter. Extremely results oriented. Every activity is measured and ladders up to hitting the number, with a strong sense of urgency when we’re behind. A proven track record of marketing to enterprise companies including traditional Fortune 500 companies. Sold to a technical audience. Developer ICP experience is a strong plus. A mix of startup and big company experience The EQ required to balance results orientation, urgency, and team morale. For candidates based in San Francisco, the pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents base salary range for non commissionable roles or on target earnings (OTE) for commissionable roles. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Retool and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors such as (but not limited to), scope and responsibilities, the candidate’s experience and qualifications, and location. Additional compensation in the form(s) of equity, and/or commission/bonuses are dependent on the position offered. Retool provides a comprehensive benefit plan, including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k). Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans. San Francisco $274,100—$370,900 USD Retool offers generous benefits to all employees and hybrid work location. For more information, please visit the benefits and perks section of our careers page! Retool is currently set up to employ all roles in the US and specific roles in the UK. To find roles that can be employed in the UK, please refer to our careers page and review the indicated locations. show less

SUPERHUMAN 👉 We exist so that professionals end each day feeling happier, more productive, and closer to achieving their potential. Today we are… The fastest email experience in the world Loved and adored: see what our customers say Our customers get through their inboxes twice as fast; many see inbox zero for the first time in years. Come shape the future of email, communication, and productivity! BUILD LOVE 💜 At Superhuman, we deeply understand how to build products that people love. We incorporate fun and play; we infuse magic and joy; we make experiences that amaze and delight. It all starts with the right team — a team that deeply cares about values, customers, and each other. CREATE MASSIVE IMPACT 🚀 We're not solving a small problem, and we're not addressing a small market. We're going after email; the one activity that consumes more of our work day than any other. Our ambition doesn't stop there. Next: calendars, notes, contacts, and tasks. We are building the productivity platform of the future. DO THE BEST WORK OF YOUR LIFE 🌟 We have created the frameworks for how to build product market fit and redefined the narrative of how to onboard customers successfully. We have shown the world it’s possible to build a premium productivity brand. Our investors include Andreessen Horowitz, First Round Capital, IVP, Tiger Global Management, Sam Altman, and the founders of Gmail, Dropbox, Reddit, Discord, Stripe, GitHub, AngelList, and Intercom. This time, we’re swinging beyond the fences and fundamentally rethinking how individuals and teams should collaborate. We are building a household brand and a worldwide organization. We are here to do the best work of our lives, and we hope you are too. As a Senior Manager, Demand Generation, you will help define and execute on our demand generation strategy as we move up market. You will experiment with new channels and programs to optimize lead generation and conversion, and will partner with sales to build playbooks and drive pipeline. ROLE 👩🏽‍💻👨‍💻 Outcome #1: Build our multi channel lead strategy to 5x MQLs over the next 18 months Identify the most effective channels (e.g., paid media, organic, ABM, partnerships) for reaching core ICP Design and execute campaigns to generate Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs) and Marketing Sourced Opportunities and drive them down the funnel. Continuously analyze and optimize the marketing funnel to improve conversion rates across stages (MQL to SQL, SQL to opportunities, oppty to closed won). Create targeted programs to engage and convert high value accounts and high value self serve users. Manage the demand generation budget to maximize ROI, balancing short term wins with long term growth investments Optimize spend across channels, campaigns, and regions. Outcome #2: Build and scale our content engine to drive conversion optimization over the next 18 months. Maximize Product Led Growth impact, in partnership with Product: Onboarding, Referrals, Virality. In product lead generation Drive retention by nurturing the full customer and user lifecycles. Outcome #3: Build team of high performing 🙂 Manage and mentor a team of external marketers to execute demand generation strategies effectively. Work alongside peer marketing leadership to drive alignment on growth strategy and execution. Work closely with sales teams to align on goals, share insights, and optimize lead handoff processes. Foster a high performance, experimentation friendly environment that supports rapid iteration and growth. Prioritize budget and resources for maximum impact on demand generation efforts. SOUND LIKE YOU? 🙌 Experience You likely have a minimum of 8 years of experience scaling a demand generation function at a B2B SaaS company, though the experience isn’t always linear! Performance Marketing Expertise Digital Advertising: Proficiency in managing campaigns on Google Ads, LinkedIn, Facebook, and other platforms. SEO and SEM: Understanding search engine optimization and paid search to increase online visibility. Email Marketing: Crafting and optimizing automated nurturing campaigns to drive engagement and conversions. PLG > PLS: General understanding of how to build programs that convert self serve business users to contracted teams accounts. Data Analytics and Metrics KPIs Mastery: You know how to define, measure, and manage sales funnel metrics and key performance indicators (e.g., CAC, MQL to SQL conversion rates, pipeline velocity). Tools Proficiency: Familiarity with platforms like Google Analytics, Tableau, Looker, and Excel for reporting and insights. A/B Testing: Experiment with content, channels, and messaging to maximize ROI. Content and Campaign Management Content Strategy: Ability to develop high impact content like eBooks, case studies, webinars, and white papers. Campaign Execution: Hands on experience designing and launching multi channel campaigns that align with buyer journeys. Remarkable Quality: You produce work that is striking, worthy of attention, and a contribution to the state of the art. Leadership and Collaboration Team Building: Recruit, mentor, and manage high performing marketing teams. Cross Functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales, product, and customer success teams to align goals and strategies. Excellent Communicator: You're able to distill complexity into clear and concise messaging. You’re effective across various mediums and are excellent at working in a remote first environment. Ownership: You accept full accountability and take initiative to find solutions to achieve results. Cares deeply, challenges directly: Discusses and debates ideas openly. Focuses on the customer and business ‘so what’ and challenges stakeholders to take impactful action. Adaptability and Innovation Agility: Stay ahead of tech trends, industry changes, and emerging platforms. Problem Solving: Tackle challenges and pivot quickly to capitalize on opportunities. Creativity: Innovate in campaign design, messaging, and branding to stand out in a crowded market. Grit: You persevere towards challenging goals which may take months or years Growth Mindset: You embrace challenges, welcome feedback, and believe you and others can always grow. Entrepreneurial: You like to spin up new initiatives and new approaches to solve problems. You work very hard, no matter how successful you have been. Revenue Focus ABM (Account Based Marketing): Knowledge of targeting high value accounts to drive larger deals. Sales Enablement: Support sales with the content, tools, and insights needed to close deals. Pipeline Contribution: Accountability for driving measurable revenue growth. SALARY INFO 💸 The Sr. Manager, Demand Generation role may span a range of experience and expertise. Through our interview process, we will review your background, local market data, and use a mix of technical and qualitative assessments to determine where you fall in our range. We will talk about compensation in our first conversation and be transparent throughout the process about which level we think is the best match for you in our organization. Our starting salaries for this role range from $200,000 $240,000. The salary range does not reflect total compensation, which includes base salary, benefits, and company stock options We are open to hiring for this role anywhere in the US. We take a locally informed approach to compensation, and our range is inclusive of starting salaries in different geographies. BENEFITS 🎁 Taking Care of Your Future 🙏 Medical, dental, and vision insurance: 100% coverage for you and 75% coverage for all your dependents. Voluntary insurance: short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance. 401(k) plan (we match 75 cents per dollar, up to 4% of your salary). Free access to Northstar, a financial wellness platform that provides financial advisors + personal finance tools. Generous Time Off 🏝 Enjoy our generous and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) policy, with our amazing team members taking an average of 20 days per year. 13 additional company holidays, plus your own Care Days, Flexible Holidays, and a company wide Winter Break. Generous parental, caregiver, healthcare, and compassionate leave policies. Investing in Your Growth ✍️ $3000 per year towards your professional development. Free access to Calm and Aaptiv. Allyship education program to help build your best self. Setting You Up For Success 🧑🏻‍💻👩🏾‍💻 Custom MacBook Pro. $1000 budget for workstation setup. $260/month for your lunches, groceries, or whatever nutrition you need to stay fueled up! Flexible spending accounts for commuter costs, dependent care, and healthcare expenses. At Superhuman, we value diversity. We are an equal opportunity employer: we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. show less

jobs.description: About Us Estate planning is vital for anyone who wants to ensure their loved ones are cared for when they’re gone. But traditional estate planning is broken. It’s confusing, expensive, and tedious, and it’s often done without regard to a person’s financial plan. Vanilla is here to change all that. We are reinventing estate planning for financial advisors, attorneys, and their clients. We’re transforming it into an ongoing conversation, where dense legal documents are brought to life through easy to understand visualizations, and considered in concert with clients’ financial plans and evolving life milestones and goals. Vanilla is the world’s first estate advisory platform, built by advisors and estate professionals to help deliver a modern, visual estate planning experience to their clients. Harnessing a purpose built AI engine called VAI, the Vanilla platform provides valuable insights to advisors and attorneys while demystifying the planning process for clients at all levels of wealth. Vanilla supports the entire estate planning process, including understanding client goals and current plans, visualizing the plan, and strategizing on taxes. Clients can even create trusts, healthcare directives, powers of attorney, and more through Vanilla. The Vanilla platform enables advisors, planners, and attorneys to foster stronger relationships, achieve greater retention, and help their clients build meaningful legacies. Job Description As part of our mission to create a category, we are looking for a marketer who loves integrated campaigns and can leverage the full funnel to both create awareness and capture demand. This role is a net new addition to our marketing team reporting directly to the CMO. The Sr Manager/Director of Demand Gen will play a pivotal role in building and shaping how demand generation works. We need this role to drive Vanilla’s growth by building, managing, and scaling our pipe generation programs across both new logos and our customer base. This role will be responsible for managing our demand funnel and account based funnel. We sell to multiple segments and need someone who can flex on standing up account based tactics while still driving pipeline in our SMB and mid market. You will work in deep partnership with our CMO and Marketing Ops manager while owning our advertising and digital budget, developing and executing demand generation strategies, and working closely with the sales and marketing teams to ensure alignment and achievement of growth goals. This is NOT a pure digital role. Key Responsibilities: Demand Generation Strategy: Develop and lead the demand generation strategy for Vanilla. This includes creating comprehensive plans to drive brand awareness, generate leads, and accelerate the sales pipeline. Integrated Marketing Campaigns: Design and execute integrated marketing campaigns that span various channels, including digital, social media, email marketing, content marketing, webinars, and events. These campaigns should effectively engage and nurture prospects at every stage of the buying journey. Account Based Marketing (ABM): Drive the expansion of our account based marketing efforts to target high value accounts. Develop and execute personalized campaigns that resonate with key decision makers and stakeholders within these accounts. Budget Ownership: Take ownership of the advertising and digital marketing budget. Allocate resources effectively to maximize ROI and continuously monitor campaign performance. Metrics and Reporting: Your key goal is marketing sourced opportunities. Together we need to backtest and establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of demand generation initiatives. Regularly analyze and report on campaign performance, making data driven adjustments to optimize results. Cross Functional Collaboration: Foster strong collaboration between the marketing and sales teams to ensure alignment on target audiences, messaging, and goals. Act as a bridge between the two departments to drive revenue growth. Qualifications: First of all, we need a person that is comfortable with rolling up sleeves and doing the work. We are a startup where everyone, including the executives, do the work. This is a role for people who like to get things done. Beyond getting it done, here’s what we are looking for: Experience: A proven track record in B2B demand generation, preferably within the tech or financial services industry. Minimum of 6 8 years of experience in demand generation and digital marketing. Strategic Thinker: Ability to think strategically and create data driven demand generation plans that align with business objectives. Account Based Marketing: Experience with ABM strategies and tactics, including targeting, personalization, and engagement with key accounts. Budget Ownership: Proficiency in managing budgets and optimizing spend to achieve ROI goals. Analytics: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and metrics to drive decisions and measure campaign effectiveness. Collaborative: A team player who can work effectively with cross functional teams and foster alignment between marketing and sales. Marketing Technology: Strong expertise with Hubspot and Salesforce. Working experience with Figma, Wordpress, and analytics tools. Marketing Math: Understand how to do the math and justify your strategy with numbers. Join us at Vanilla and be part of our mission to revolutionize estate planning and help families create meaningful legacies. If you're passionate about demand generation, enjoy tackling complex challenges, and want to make a significant impact in a growing company, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and let's redefine estate planning together! Vanilla Technologies Inc. (dba "Vanilla") provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Vanilla participates in E Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I 9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. Compensation Range: $150K $200K show less

jobs.description: Maven is the world's largest virtual clinic for women and families on a mission to make healthcare work for all of us. Maven's award winning digital programs provide clinical, emotional, and financial support all in one platform, spanning fertility & family building, maternity & newborn care, parenting & pediatrics, and menopause & midlife. More than 2,000 employers and health plans trust Maven's end to end platform to improve clinical outcomes, reduce healthcare costs, and provide equity in benefits programs. Recognized for innovation and industry leadership, Maven has been named to the Time 100 Most Influential Companies, CNBC Disruptor 50, Fast Company Most Innovative Companies, and FORTUNE Best Places to Work. Founded in 2014 by CEO Kate Ryder, Maven has raised more than $425 million in funding from top healthcare and technology investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia, Dragoneer Investment Group, Oak HC/FT, StepStone Group, Icon Ventures, and Lux Capital. To learn more about Maven, visit us at mavenclinic.com. An award winning culture working towards an important mission – Maven Clinic is a recipient of over 30 workplace and innovation awards, including: Fortune Change the World (2024) CNBC Disruptor 50 List (2022, 2023, 2024) Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials (2024) Fortune Best Workplaces in Health Care (2024) TIME 100 Most Influential Companies (2023) Fast Company Most Innovative Companies (2020, 2023) Built In Best Places to Work (2023) Fortune Best Workplaces NY (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024) Great Place to Work certified (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024) Fast Company Best Workplaces for Innovators (2022) Built In LGBTQIA+ Advocacy Award (2022) Maven is hiring a VP, Demand Generation to help millions access Maven’s exceptional care for women and families by leading a team that inspires, educates, and activates employers and health plans to offer Maven’s fertility, maternity, parenting & pediatrics, and menopause tracks. To be great at this role, you’re an exceptional B2B demand generation strategist who can both deeply analyze and clearly communicate Maven’s approach to pipeline generation against aggressive growth targets (b) an inspiring “player coach” adept at managing teams through change and up leveling B2B marketing capabilities and (c) a “driver” who innovates on existing strategies and channels, while knowing where to “double down” on what’s working well. You’ll own the B2B Demand Generation strategy, partnering closely with our Sales, Client Success, and Product Marketing teams to meet company pipeline targets while driving prioritization and execution alignment to do so. You don’t hesitate to drive progress across teams amidst uncertainty, and have an unyielding bias for action. You also have deep B2B Marketing expertise leading and partnering with teams to craft and implement personalized campaigns for target accounts, expanding our inbound and outbound efforts through diverse channels including email, events, webinars, content syndication, and social media. We’re looking for a proactive, analytical, and metrics driven leader who thrives in setting and executing strategy – with a proven track record of scaling and optimizing ABM, demand generation, CRO & SEO tactics across the marketing funnel in the ever changing ambiguity of successful startup environments. As VP, Demand Generation, you will: Lead and scale the growth marketing function and team across Demand Generation, ABX, Events, Marketing Operations, SEO and CRO, setting a growth strategy that achieves and supports Maven’s revenue goals Define a strategy that clearly segments, sizes, and prioritizes Maven’s B2B audiences and corresponding marketing strategies to achieve aggressive pipeline growth targets Develop and implement demand generation strategies that span the entire marketing funnel, from awareness to conversion; Regularly report on overall and channel specific ROI Develop paid marketing strategies and manage a team to execute against those strategies, including budget management and planning, channel allocation, and channel testing Analyze our current processes and tech stack for executing and analyzing the B2B Marketing effectiveness, actioning improvements across teams where needed Set the operating rhythm to provide regular performance reports, forecasts, escalations, insights, and recommendations to the executive team and cross functional leadership Proactively address talent needs, fostering a high performance culture that attracts, develops, and retains top marketing talent; Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire a diverse team and influence cross functional partners We’re looking for you to bring: 15+ years of marketing experience, with at least 7 years as a leader focused on demand generation in B2B SaaS or Health Tech Demonstrated experience building and leading high performing teams, fostering a high performance culture, and improving organizational health. Proven experience managing complex marketing organizations and developing and implementing successful B2B marketing strategies at scale Strong track record of driving business outcomes through strategic and operational excellence – navigating organizational culture and influencing decision making processes. Excellent communication skills, capable of engaging with executive level stakeholders and representing the company externally. A “driver” mindset— adeptly partners with across teams to drive swift progress and action toward our company pipeline goal, and resolves any ambiguity to do so Demonstrated ability to innovate and solve ambiguous problems, introducing new solutions and driving transformation. Deep expertise in tools such as HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Looker, SEMrush, Ahrefs and Asana. The base salary range for this role is $220,000 $280,000 per year. You will also be entitled to receive stock options and benefits. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, and skillset. This role requires active work authorization in the US. Benefits That Work For You Our benefits are designed to support your health, well being and career development, helping you thrive both personally and professionally. We remain focused on providing a competitive benefits package for our employees. On top of standards such as employer covered health, dental, and insurance plan options, we offer an inclusive approach to benefits: Maven for Mavens: access to the full platform and specialists, including care for mental health, reproductive health, family planning and pediatrics. Whole self care through wellness partnerships Hybrid work, in office meals, and work together days 16 weeks 100% paid parental leave and new parent stipend (for Mavens who've been with us for six months plus) Annual professional development stipend and access to a personal career coach through Maven for Mavens 401K matching for US based employees, with immediate vesting These benefits are applicable to Maven Clinic Co., US based, full time employees only. 1099/Contract Providers are ineligible for these benefits. Maven is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Maven is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. Maven Clinic interview requests and job offers only originate from an @mavenclinic.com email address (e.g jsmith@mavenclinic.com). Maven Clinic will never ask for sensitive information to be delivered over email or phone. If you receive a scam issue or a security issue involving Maven Clinic please notify us at: security@mavenclinic.com. For general and additional inquiries, please contact us at careers@mavenclinic.com. show less

jobs.description: About Finch We are on a mission to empower innovators to access the global employment ecosystem and connect the world's employers under a single API. To do this, we're looking for individuals who think about problems holistically and in depth, who are relentlessly curious, self starters, and determined to drive ideas from inception through to completion. Finch is a Series B company backed by a fantastic set of firms, angels, and our developers including General Catalyst, Menlo Ventures, Homebrew, BoxGroup, YCombinator, Charley (1st business hire at Plaid), Sima (ex Head of Biz Dev at Plaid), Henrique + Pedro (co CEOs at Brex), Jeff + Wayne (co CEOs at Digits), Immad (CEO at Mercury), Sam (CEO at Vouch Insurance), Karim (CTO at Ramp), and more. About Our Team We're a team of problem solvers who aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. We value velocity, curiosity, empathy, and diverse perspectives. Everyone on the team is excited about the scope of the problems we address and the potential impact our work can have on the global workforce. We realize that the value we provide comes with great responsibilities, and therefore make security and privacy our highest priorities. We come from a diverse set of backgrounds and each member brings different skills to the group. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and potential will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. About The Role You’ll be the leader for demand generation efforts at Finch, reporting to the VP of Marketing. We’re looking for a hands on, data driven digital and account based marketing (ABM) expert and growth marketer to help us drive and expand awareness and accelerate our pipeline. You will own critical business metrics, laddering directly to new business revenue goals and help us build our tech stack to scale. You will oversee key channels such as paid search & paid social, email marketing, and our new account based marketing (ABM) motion in partnership with the BDR and Sales teams. You will have team/agency support across paid advertising, field marketing, and email. You’ll be joining a small but mighty marketing team of rockstars including Sr PMM and Content leaders to help you operationalize your plans, as well as a standout Revenue Operations leader who will be your partner in tracking and analytics. What You'll Do Own Demand Generation at Finch, including generating inbound and accelerating outbound via paid advertising, marketing automation and nurture, as well as experiments with offline channels. Scale our ABM pilot to be a more effective and targeted engine to connect and convert our ICP in partnership with our sales and revenue operations teams. Drive lead nurture and operational efficiency in our lifecycle/nurture engine. Own and operate our Hubspot instance and leverage Salesforce in partnership with revenue operations. Operationalize and scale our paid growth channels through strategic direction on targeting our ICP, launching new campaigns, and mapping channel activity to lead funnel stage to increase sales cycle efficiency. You’ll work with our paid advertising agency and design contractors to create and execute a systematic testing roadmap to drive results. Analyze and provide insights on multi channel marketing performance including paid channels, SEM, webinars, videos, and email nurture to maximize Finch growth. Extensively use Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Ads, and Google Search Console for conversion rate optimization, SEO & SEM. Develop and manage budgets and forecasts, optimizing initiatives for impact on the bottom line Experiment with non digital channels such as direct mail and gifting (in collaboration with outbound sales) and targeted out of home placements. Support our field marketing program with directed digital outreach and post event one to many nurture. Refine pipeline generation and ROI measurement instrumentation with the revenue ops team. We have some great tools already in place, you’ll get to dream up what’s next! What You'll Bring 5+ years of B2B demand, growth, or marketing operations experience 2+ years of managing a paid program, including working with design & agencies Demonstrated a history of creative problem solving and executing out of the box campaigns Excellent analytics skills ability to assess not just what happens in one channel but how paid, owned and marketing automation channels work together to effectively drive revenue in a sales led growth motion. Insatiable curiosity and passion for data analysis to deliver insights and troubleshooting issues. Ability to make data driven decisions on where to invest next, what hypothesis to test as well as what to scale down and move on. Extensive experience developing and measuring multi channel integrated campaigns that attract, deeply engage and convert prospects into pipeline growth Excellent grasp of marketing automation operation in concert with paid digital and SDR/BDR outreach. (we use Hubspot, but experience with Adobe Marketo, Oracle Eloqua, etc.is helpful) Great collaboration and communication skills. Ability to take the lead on a project and see it through from start to finish while making sure your partners and stakeholders are part of the solution. Ability to spot and operationalize great copy– you won’t always have to do all the writing, but you’ll need to be able to create campaigns for multiple personas and verticals. Skills Growth experience that is multi channel including paid, email and offline channels Experience in analytics, delivering not just channel performance but insights Expert operational proficiency in Hubspot Experience with Salesforce Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Ads, and Google Search Console Analytical expertise extracting not just metrics but channel insights Experience creating a cross channel and cross GTM team testing roadmap Excellent communication, including presentation skills Ability to effectively run cross functional team meetings to align stakeholders across sales, revenue operations and marketing with clear next steps, goals and outcomes Experience working with/managing agencies to supplement capacity $160,000 $180,000 a year Finch’s compensation package includes a competitive base salary benchmarked against real time market data, as well as equity for all full time roles. We want all full time employees to be invested in Finch and to be able to take advantage of that investment, so our equity grants include a 10 year exercise window. We also offer exceptional benefits. Our minimum salary range for this role is: $160,000 $180,000 Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on geography, candidate experience and expertise, and other factors. This is a hybrid role requiring two days per week in office in either our San Francisco or NYC offices. Finch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. show less

jobs.description: Gong transforms revenue organizations by harnessing customer interactions to increase business efficiency, improve decision making and accelerate revenue growth. The Revenue Intelligence Platform uses proprietary artificial intelligence technology to enable teams to capture, understand and act on all customer interactions in a single, integrated platform. More than 4,000 companies around the world rely on Gong to support their go to market strategies and grow revenue efficiently. For more information, visit www.gong.io. As our Vice President, Growth & Demand Generation, you will lead a talented growing function. You will be responsible for setting the growth strategy and overseeing the execution of demand generation and customer campaigns and tactics to continue on our growth trajectory. Responsibilities Lead a team of growth and campaign marketers focusing on segment and industry growth strategy & tactics. Demand gen, performance marketing, ABM, and customer campaigns are just some of the functions you will be responsible for. Own the pipeline number, working with the extended marketing team to define the growth plan, channel mix, data & analytics for Gong’s growth function to drive net new and expansion pipeline across all segments, across the entire customer lifecycle, and across industries. Scale and optimize n high quality digital channels and multi channel campaign execution including paid search, paid social, email marketing, and webinar programs. Build out a demand center of excellence to enable Gong’s business to scale to drive pipeline growth and support customer retention and expansion. Partner with the GTM Ops and Finance on the strategy needed for the business to hit its ambitious growth targets. Define and own KPIs for targets and tracking performance metrics on a daily or weekly basis and iterate quickly to optimize, proactively detect, and course correct immediately. Partner across functions within marketing to improve our marketing reach, efficiency, and drive outstanding customer experiences. Lead the strategy for executing data driven integrated campaigns in partnership with other marketing teams to reach target audiences and in alignment with strategic market moments to extend reach. Identify and solve business problems with an inquisitive mindset, looking to question assumptions, and bringing creativity to drive business value. Have a strong goal and outcome orientation to marketing efforts. Have the communication skills to convey complex ideas with clarity, confidence, and authority. Hire, develop, and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team. Qualifications 10 15+ years of marketing experience in B2B enterprise software (SaaS experience preferred) with a strong, demonstrable focus on pipeline growth and high quality execution. Proven success in building, developing, and leading demand generation and growth teams. Experience at a company scaling to >$500M and ideally >1B in ARR. World class business acumen with a bias for data driven decision making and velocity of execution. A strong team player but still a self starter who thrives in a fast paced, high growth start up environment. Someone who flourishes when given responsibility and a sense of ownership. jobs.description: This is Adyen Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition. For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster. Senior Demand Generation Manager At Adyen, we are at the forefront of financial technology, driving innovation in payment solutions for enterprise businesses globally. We are seeking an experienced, data driven and self motivated Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager to drive impactful acquisition strategies for our Unified Commerce business within the North America market. This hybrid role will work from our San Francisco or New York office and report directly to our Unified Commerce Marketing Team Lead. As a Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager at Adyen, you are pipeline driven, highly collaborative, and always learning. You will own the strategic vision for demand generation, including planning, building and optimizing targeted marketing campaigns across owned and paid channels. Verkada offers six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace and intercoms — integrated with a single cloud based software platform. jobs.description: Who We Are WillowTree, a TELUS Digital Company, partners with the world’s leading brands to help them tackle their thorniest challenges be it launching new digital products, delivering personalized marketing at scale, or harnessing the power of data and AI to transform their business. These mission critical initiatives aren’t solved by a single discipline. Great digital is a team game it requires seamlessly combining strategy, engineering, design, data science, marketing, and more. Other firms have bolted on these capabilities as digital natives, we’ve built them into our teams from Day 1. The result? Top and bottom lines that grow, alongside our client’s capabilities. Check out how we have impacted our clients' digital portfolios over the years. Location Our Demand Generation Manager is an integral part of our team at WillowTree. To help retain our deep culture of collaboration, this role will maintain an in office presence in a hybrid capacity in our Charlottesville (VA) or Boston (MA) offices. The Opportunity As a Demand Generation Manager at WillowTree you will be a strategic thinker and proactive doer who partners strongly with BD, delivery, and demand gen leadership to support the execution of multi channel campaigns, eschewing content from concept to reality, organizing webinars, informing advertising, supporting event marketing, and doing all the things it takes to build and sustain a drumbeat of market noise for a specific product/service over an extended period of time. You will be responsible for the ultimate delivery of campaigns from start to finish by ensuring your efforts help to drive revenue by collecting sales & marketing intelligence that informs BD’s go to market and making sure that the dots between the sales and marketing team remain seamlessly connected. Responsibilities Develop and execute demand generation campaigns to develop and nurture relationships with prospects within our target account lists. Partner with the VP of Demand Generation as a strategic contributor and as key driver of progress by managing stakeholders across the business and projects. Help articulate and evangelize WillowTree’s point of view within service lines, verticals, and the intersection between the two by leading the ideation, development, and syndication of thought leadership content. Help translate key market trends and WillowTree’s brand positioning to inform the creative development of digital advertising campaigns. Develop and activate new Sales & Marketing “plays” that connect the dots between market intelligence derived from marketing campaigns and our Business Development teams. Lead sales enablement initiatives that educate the Business Development team on our latest service offerings by partnering with Delivery leaders to understand what’s new. Act as the voice of the client for the service lines and personas you represent by becoming an expert in their markets, challenges, and opportunities. Closely collaborate with our Business Development VPs to crystallize ideal customer profiles, augment target account lists, and bring market trends to the forefront. Develop repeatable go to market mechanics that scale with the growth of the business. Qualifications Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams. Ability to write clearly and persuasively for both internal and external audiences. Robust analytical and problem solving abilities, coupled with the talent to make data driven recommendations. Working knowledge of our industry and/or knowledge of one or more of WillowTree's core verticals or service lines. Data & AI being a big plus. Intermediate level or higher proficiency in SalesForce, ability to create campaigns, track campaign performance, and run reports to surface insights. Bonus points for candidates with an MBA. Why WillowTree? We offer a place to be yourself. Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That’s why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You’ll work hard here; however, we’ll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well being. We’re committed to creating an environment of inclusion — a place where every Tree can thrive. We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits. WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. What We'll Offer In addition to a great culture and interesting work with opportunities for growth and development, this position is eligible for the following benefits: Healthcare benefits Medical, Vision, Dental (Including an option for 100% coverage of individual employee medical premiums) Life & Disability Insurance 401K matching Flexible paid time off & paid company holidays Parental Leave Employee Share Purchase Plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) And more! Individual compensation is based on various factors unique to each candidate, including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job related reasons determined during the interview process. Role ranges are periodically reviewed and updated based on market changes, internal needs, and industry trends. To drive ongoing pay equity for team members, WillowTree conducts regular compensation audits. USA Pay Range $140,000 — $160,000 USD show less

jobs.description: The salary range for this position is $128,500 $180,000 annually. FreshRealm is currently in a high growth state, and our culture of ACTIONS drives our team members forward to maximize their potential. We are a team of hardworking, passionate leaders who persevere through challenges, collaborate with one another to problem solve and achieve desired outcomes, and work to bring out the best in our employees as we service our customers. At FreshRealm , we welcome individuals from all backgrounds and abilities to apply and make employment decisions based on merit . As we continue to expand, we're seeking driven and talented individuals who are excited about reimagining the future of fresh food with innovative solutions and meaningful customer engagement. We’re looking for a talented and passionate Director of Demand Generation to join our team and play a key role in shaping and scaling our offerings across the U.S. market. As the Director of Demand Generation, you will lead and execute our demand generation strategy to drive company growth and revenue. Reporting directly to the VP of Marketing, you will be responsible for crafting and implementing a data driven, multi channel demand generation program designed to attract and engage our target audience, convert leads, and optimize the sales funnel. You will work cross functionally with Creative, Product, Business Development, Customer Success, Operations and other teams to deliver impactful campaigns and initiatives that drive measurable results and propel our mission forward. Key Responsibilities Demand Generation Strategy and Execution Develop and lead the overall demand generation strategy, balancing top of funnel awareness with mid to bottom funnel conversions, focused on customer acquisition and retention. Identify key segments within target markets, creating personalized, multichannel campaigns that address unique needs, preferences, and behaviors. Execute demand generation programs through email marketing, digital advertising (e.g., SEM, social, trade and business media), content syndication, webinars, white papers, events, and partnerships. Leverage data driven insights to plan, execute, and measure campaigns that increase brand visibility and deliver a high quality pipeline of leads. Lead Nurturing and Funnel Optimization Design and optimize lead nurturing campaigns to convert qualified leads into loyal customers, increasing customer lifetime value and minimizing churn. Implement marketing automation solutions to manage and scale lead nurturing efforts while improving customer journey touchpoints. Develop segmented content and targeting strategies tailored to various stages of the buyer’s journey and specific audience personas. Continuously analyze conversion metrics and engagement data to optimize performance and refine the customer journey. Channel Development and Management Oversee a multi channel demand generation strategy across digital, content marketing, influencer marketing, social media, email, and paid media channels. Collaborate with the Marketing and Creative teams to develop compelling campaigns that align with brand and product objectives . Evaluate, select, and manage external vendors and agencies as needed, ensuring campaign alignment, performance, and cost effectiveness. Keep a pulse on industry trends and new marketing technologies, identifying emerging channels and strategies that can expand reach and effectiveness. Performance Analysis and Reporting Set, track, and analyze KPIs for demand generation initiatives, providing transparency on pipeline impact, campaign ROI, and channel performance. Prepare detailed reports on campaign effectiveness, including recommendations for improvement, key takeaways, and insights for the marketing leadership team. Partner with the Analytics team to leverage customer data, behavior insights, and predictive models to refine targeting, improve personalization, and enhance campaign efficacy. Utilize A/B testing, conversion rate optimization, and data analysis to refine campaigns and maximize ROI. Internal/External Stakeholder Management Work closely with the Business Development, Creative and Customer Success teams to ensure alignment on messaging, audience targeting, and handoff processes. Partner with Marketing team to develop and refine persona specific messaging, competitive positioning, and launch plans for new product initiatives. Foster a collaborative environment within the Marketing team and lead team members through demand generation best practices. Serve as a demand generation thought leader, sharing insights, training, and industry best practices across teams. Engage with external vendors and partners to support product initiatives, collaborating on integrations, service improvements, and customer solutions. Qualifications Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Marketing , Business, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus. Minimum of 8 10 years of experience in B2C or B2B demand generation, with a proven track record of driving customer acquisition and revenue growth, preferably in high growth or start up environments. Experience in the food industry, subscription services, or eCommerce is a significant advantage. Skills Strategic Thinker : Ability to develop and execute a strategic demand generation plan that aligns with business objectives and drives measurable growth. Data Driven & Analytical : Proficient in analyzing data to measure campaign success, uncover insights, and optimize future initiatives. Experience with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Tableau, or Looker). Technical Fluency : Experience with marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot) and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce). Digital Marketing Expertise : Skilled in managing PPC, social media, SEO, email marketing, and display advertising campaigns, with a deep understanding of digital metrics and optimization. Strong Communicator : Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders and collaborate cross functionally. Project Management : Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines in a fast paced environment. What We Offer Comprehensive benefits package for full time employees including medical, dental, vision, pet insurance and legal insurance 401(k) with company match that is immediately vested Life and ADD insurance Opportunities for career growth with a dynamic company that is changing the landscape of fresh meals. Unlimited paid time off Our Values at Work We believe that ACTIONS speak louder than words and our company values align to those ACTIONS. In Our Daily Work, This Looks Like ACCOUNTABILITY : Set clear objectives and prioritize your tasks Hold yourself and your teams accountable for meeting deadlines Learn from your mistakes and use it as a learning opportunity to improve next time CHALLENGE WITH CURIOSITY : We challenge and engage with each other through curiosity and a drive to innovate and transform. This encourages us to learn from one another, be open minded to other perspectives and possibilities, and continuously improve and problem solve with intensity. We persevere through challenges, observe patterns, and pay attention to the details to make connections others may overlook, allowing us to exceed expectations. TRANSPARENCY & HONESTY : Maintain open and consistent communication. Admit mistakes and take ownership Document decisions to help avoid misunderstandings INNOVATION : Work with the end user in mind and create solutions that will add value Question existing norms, assumptions, and best practices Experiment and take calculated, data driven risks OBJECTIVITY : Utilize data and make data driven decisions at every opportunity NIMBLENESS : Utilize time management to help stay focused and on task with urgency es and adjust accordingly Delegate and trust others to handle specific responsibilities with resources and support SUCCESS THROUGH OUR CUSTOMERS : Know your audience and the type of work they expect to receive as the end result of a project, initiative, or task Seek feedback at different stages to ensure you’re on the right track foster collaboration among cross functional teams to ensure you’re providing the best experience and service to our consumers Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location . We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements . We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Apply Now show less

jobs.description: SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY: Candidates are required to sit in our Palo Alto, CA office 3x a week. Responsibilities As to be expected in a start up moving as fast as we are, the scope of this position will evolve continuously. Comfort with ambiguity is required. Below is a partial representation of what may be included in the Demand Generation and Integrated Campaigns scope of responsibilities: Drive the growth of brand awareness, lead generation and engagement within our target segments and personas by using a variety of digital and traditional acquisition channels to generate interactions for our BDR organization. Design, implement, and iterate on Glean’s integrated campaign framework, ensuring effective collaboration and integration with Digital, Field Marketing, Partnerships, Brand Design, Content Marketing/Communications, Strategic Events, Product Marketing, Sales, Operations, and other relevant stakeholders to create streamlined planning and execution processes. You and your team will act as the glue between strategy and execution, ensuring smooth rollout and strong results for Glean’s campaigns cross functionally. Plan, develop, and execute demand generation programs and integrated marketing campaigns across product announcements, key content assets, creative promotions, meeting makers, and more. Own our Account Based Everything strategy and project manage the execution of various tactics across multiple stakeholders and channels with a focus of driving impactful and measurable outcomes within our target accounts. Lead annual global marketing calendar development, including regular updates and enablement communication for cross functional teams. Own the webinar program from concept through to promotion, logistics, and follow up, including direct, 3rd party, and partner webinars. Develop multi touch omnichannel nurture programs to engage prospects and move them through the funnel. Create conversion optimized copy for emails and landing pages that promote our campaigns targeting our various personas. Work closely with business development and account executive teams to develop enablement materials and feedback loops for continuous optimization. Analyze campaign results in detail, draw insights and make data based adjustments. Familiar with CRM and marketing automation tools; SFDC and Marketo preferred. Experience with Sendoso/Postal and Outreach is a plus. Experience with creating engaging and creative content for awareness and demand generation campaigns. Excellent written communication skills: you will be developing conversion optimized copy for email, landing pages, ads, etc. Project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively. Collaborative team player and self starter, ability to influence cross functional stakeholders to bring them along on your journey. Experience driving revenue results across multiple channels, including scaling global strategy for local execution. Experience with and understanding of traditional, digital and emerging channels to create demand. A deep understanding of integrated campaign best practices, playbooks, customer journeys, etc. Experience growing a database organically and generating warm leads for SDRs and BDRs. Ability to learn new technologies, products and systems quickly. Creative, innovative, resourceful, with the ability to work successfully in an ever changing environment with competing priorities. Most of all, a general “can do” whatever it takes attitude to solve any problem and win at any challenge. jobs.description: About GrowthLoop GrowthLoop is reimagining marketing through its AI powered platform built on the data cloud. GrowthLoop is already voted the #1 composable CDP on G2, and it is building on that foundation by investing heavily in an agentic future that will drive incredible outcomes for its enterprise customers. Built for and by marketers, GrowthLoop has a flexible, no code solution that empowers teams to unlock their first party data to activate valuable, impact driving campaigns with agility. GrowthLoop is leading the charge for a new era of marketing. Our Mission Unleash the growth potential of the world's most innovative brands by closing the loop between people, data, and AI. How We Work We bring a learner's mindset to everything we do. We encourage the exploration of new technologies and ownership to drive them. We believe in the power of collaboration, innovation, and gratitude. Our love for our customers drives us to go the extra mile and build the best products for them. We ship with urgency and extreme ownership. Our culture and people are our greatest strength. The Opportunity GrowthLoop is pioneering a new category of AI on the data cloud, transforming how marketing campaigns deliver measurable impact in ways enterprise CMO's have never seen before. We are looking for a visionary and hands on Director of Enterprise Demand Generation to join our GTM team and play a critical leadership role in bringing GrowthLoop's new category to life in 2025. Building on our momentum with industry leading customers like Google, Priceline, and Indeed, you'll be on the front lines of the Agentic AI movement for marketing teams. You'll use your expertise to drive innovative demand gen programs that not only inspire our customers and accelerate our growth, but also positions GrowthLoop as a thought leader in this transformative space. This role requires both strategic vision and tactical execution to deliver meaningful results at every level —from crafting full funnel demand generation plans to executing personalized 1:1 ABM experiences that resonate with enterprise audiences. This role is the right fit for someone passionate about shaping the future of AI powered marketing and excited to make an immediate impact in a fast paced organization at the forefront of a new category. What You'll Do Collaborate with sales leadership and bring a sense of urgency to meet all pipeline targets and bookings goals. Design and execute a multi channel demand generation strategy that helps us sell with and through our cloud partners. Build and run ABM programs that drive marketing engagement in named enterprise accounts, and deliver highly personalized, scalable experiences that foster authentic connections with our target prospects. Work alongside our event and partner marketers to meet all pipeline targets. Measure and analyze performance constantly, flexing a data driven approach to developing and adapting content and campaigns. Be consistently "AI Curious" by staying on the cutting edge of emerging AI technologies and their applications in demand generation. Design, implement, and analyze experiments that use AI to modernize and optimize demand generation programs. Share key insights and learnings from AI driven experiments internally, to foster a culture of innovation and collaboration. What We Look For 10+ years of progressive enterprise demand generation experience, with the majority of your career focused on driving pipeline in B2B SaaS environments. Strong background leading demand generation within partnership heavy GTM motions. Doesn't shy away from getting hands on in developing and executing highly targeted enterprise ABM strategies, from conception to implementation. A sharp writer with the ability to craft engaging copy (email, paid ads, landing pages, etc.) and brings a deep understanding of how compelling content and messaging drives action through the buyer's journey. Demonstrated curiosity and early adoption of AI capabilities and tools, with a focus on driving innovation and improving marketing outcomes. Analytical mindset, skilled in tracking, measuring, and optimizing camping performance with clear ROI insights. Experience collaborating with event and field teams to drive pipeline growth and accelerate lead conversion. Excellent martech expertise with deep proficiency in modern technology stacks (we use Salesforce, HubSpot, and Cognism), and a strong understanding of marketing operations to build and drive multi channel campaigns at scale. Excellent communication and facilitation skills, both at the executive level and with peers and cross functional teams. Self starter who can think quickly and creatively in a fast paced environment; comfortable with ambiguity and rapid change. The estimated salary range is $180,000 200,000 OTE. The total compensation will also include equity in the company. Final base salary decisions will be based on a variety of non discriminatory factors, such as the individual's performance, experience, and qualifications. What We Offer Rewards See your work impact some of the most important businesses in the world, including Google, Priceline and Indeed. Spot bonuses for major milestones and product feature graduations Opportunities for career progression and dynamic collaboration across teams Equity incentives for employees making an impact Flexible Work Style Remote First Culture Flexible schedules and goal based workstyle Unbounded PTO Monthly Recharge Days Competitive Benefits Free Platinum Health Insurance with Aetna 401(k) Program with Generous Company Match Learn and Grow Quarterly Hackathons to focus on team passion projects Education Stipend towards your professional development Work closely with our world class executive team Learners' mindset culture GrowthLoop is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. show less
